alert.note: Alert for Eastern Tucker (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 21 at 2:35PM EST until December 22 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG WINTER STORM WILL CREATE MULTIPLE HAZARDS ACROSS THE REGION... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 6 PM EST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around one quarter of an inch. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible, with wind chill values as low as 35 below zero. Wind gusts over 50 mph are expected Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * WHERE...Eastern Tucker County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM to 6 PM EST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Significant ice accumulation on power lines and tree limbs, combined with the strong winds may cause widespread and long-lasting power outages.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Persons are urged to stay indoors until conditions improve. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will keep you from losing your body heat. Wrap pipes with insulation and seal windows to avoid loss of heat from your home. Keep a slow steady stream of water running from indoor faucets, and open cabinet doors to allow warm air to circulate around inside pipes. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
